description: Demolition of existing two storey house and detached garage (Conservation Area Consent)
decision_conditions: Works for the demolition of these buildings or any part thereof shall not be commenced before a valid construction contract under which one of the parties is obliged to carry out and itself complete the works of redevelopment of the site for which planning permission was granted simultaneously with this consent has been entered into and evidence of such construction contract has first been submitted to and formally accepted in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON:	To prevent premature demolition and the creation of a cleared site which would be harmful to the visual amenity of the area and adversely affect its character, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B1, B5, B21, B22, B24, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8. | No works authorised by this consent shall take place until the applicant/developer has implemented a programme of building recording and analysis by a person or body approved by the Council as Local Planning Authority. This programme shall be in accordance with a written scheme which has been submitted by the applicant and approved by the Local Planning Authority as advised by English Heritage.  REASON: To ensure that the works are properly recorded and to ensure that the building proposed to be replaced harmonise with the character of the area, in accordance with Adopted Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Policies B1, B5, B21, B22, B24, ES6, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8.
